heading: # Color directive
headingText: The `v-color` directive is used to set text, background and border color of any given element.

usage.desc: Use `v-color` directive on a component or an HTML element with an argument to specify the property that you want to set. By default it will set the **background-color** property if no argument is being passed.

parsing.heading: ### Color parsing
parsing.desc: You can use the name of material color or css color.

border-modifiers.heading: ### Border modifiers
border-modifiers.desc: Add modifiers to specify which side of the border you want to style: `top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left`

options.modifiers.top.right.bottom.left: Specify which side of the border you want to style
options.value: It can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).
